> <OLD>
>
> Tucson knew that heading right into them would only put him in =
the same vunlerable position as Rodimus. If he is going to rescue him he kn=
ew he had to be careful as to how to approach the situation. He looks up at=
 the rail car, and then to the insectile creatures with a calculating expre=
ssion. He wasn't about to tell them what he was up to. And like a true ninj=
abot, he crouches, builds up the energy in his legs, and then springs up wi=
th kinetic force, to attempt to grab onto the rail car to get him at least =
away from the creatures to where he could plan his next move.
>
> "Not on m=
y watch."
>
> Is the only word wispered from Tucson's mouth.

The creatures=
 move in Tuscon's direction with a surprising speed and
agility, their mult=
iple legs giving them enhanced balance and
stability. However just as they =
were about to reach Tuscon and sink
their long claws into him he leaped int=
o the air! Grabbing on one
handhold and then another he leaped and swung an=
d leaped again,
quickly pulling and pushing himself in the direction of the=

magnetically powered rail-car above his head.

A glance below him shows Tu=
scon that the insect-spider like creatures
are making no attempt to follow =
him, but they are watching the car as
it travels.

Inside the car it appear=
s well maintained. it is as if who ever lived
and worked here had only left=
 a few hours ago, everything about it was
still clean, working and complete=
ly serviceable.

Inside the car Tuscon can see a figure laying on the floor=
 apparently
unconscious shoved into a corner.

(TAG)

Preston
